Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_name: FIELD EXP E AWND CALIB RDR TEMPERATURE AND VELOCITY V1.0
Data_Set_PDS3.citation_text: Greeley, R., FIELD EXP E AWND CALIB RDR TEMPERATURE AND VELOCITY V1.0, FEXP-E-AWND-3-RDR-TEMP-VELOCITY-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 1991
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_terse_desc: The Wind Experiment Archive contains calibrated reduced data records (RDRs) acquired using field-portable anemometer masts and temperature sensors during the earth-based 1989 Geologic Remote Sensing Field Experiment (GRSFE).
Data_Set_PDS3.abstract_desc: Near surface winds were studied at two sites on Lunar Lake Playa: (a) Lunar Lake North is at the northeast end of the playa, on a smooth clay-silt surface; and (b) Lunar Lake South is toward the center of the playa, just east of the area of prominent basalt gravel bars, on the playa. In addition to providing data on surface winds to GRSFE, these investigations will provide input to studies of the relationships between the radar backscatter and aeolian roughness characteristics of desert surfaces.
Data_Set_PDS3.data_set_desc:
Data Set Overview ================= Near surface winds were studied at two sites on Lunar Lake Playa:
(a) Lunar Lake North is at the northeast end of the playa, on a smooth clay-silt surface; and
(b) Lunar Lake South is toward the center of the playa, just east of the area of prominent basalt gravel bars on the playa.
In addition to providing data on surface winds to GRSFE, these investigations will provide input to studies of the relationships between the radar backscatter and aeolian roughness characteristics of desert surfaces.
Data were recorded at Lunar Lake North between 13:32 on 16 July 1989 and 17:16 on 18 July 1989 for a total of 52 hours; and at Lunar Lake South between 16:51 on 16 July 1989 and 16:13 on 18 July 1989 for a total of 48 hours. During these periods, wind speeds recorded at a height of 9.6 m varied between 1.36 and 8.16 m/sec. The 20 minute averages of wind speed recorded do not reflect the very unsteady and gusty wind conditions that were observed during GRSFE. Wind directions during periods of winds above 4 m/sec were mostly from south to southeast. Wind data are presented in degrees clockwise from magnetic north. Temperatures at a height of 1.5 m above the surface ranged from a minimum of 9.25 degrees C around 05:00 on 17 July, to a maximum of 35.62 degrees C on the afternoon of 18 July.
The wind experiment data set is divided into two files, one for each wind tower. The data are in tabular form.
Processing Level Id : 3 Software Flag : N Processing Start Time : 1989-07-19T00:00:00.000 Processing Stop Time : 1991-05-28T00:00:00.000
Parameters ==========
Data Set Parameter 'TEMPERATURE' -------------------------------- The temperature of a system is a measure of the heat content of the system, and determines if a system is in thermal equilibrium with other systems.
Data Set Parameter Name : TEMPERATURE Data Set Parameter Unit : DEGREES Sampling Parameter Name : TIME Sampling Parameter Unit : MINUTE Minimum Sampling Parameter : N/A Maximum Sampling Parameter : N/A Sampling Parameter Resolution : N/A Sampling Parameter Interval : 20 Minimum Available Sampling Int : N/A Noise Level : N/A
Data Set Parameter 'WIND DIRECTION' ----------------------------------- Compass direction of the wind velocity vector.
Data Set Parameter Name : WIND DIRECTION Data Set Parameter Unit : DEGREES Sampling Parameter Name : TIME Sampling Parameter Unit : MINUTE Minimum Sampling Parameter : N/A Maximum Sampling Parameter : N/A Sampling Parameter Resolution : N/A Sampling Parameter Interval : 20 Minimum Available Sampling Int : N/A Noise Level : N/A
Data Set Parameter 'WIND SPEED' ------------------------------- Magnitude of the wind velocity vector.
Data Set Parameter Name : WIND SPEED Data Set Parameter Unit : METERS/SECOND Sampling Parameter Name : TIME Sampling Parameter Unit : MINUTE Minimum Sampling Parameter : N/A Maximum Sampling Parameter : N/A Sampling Parameter Resolution : N/A Sampling Parameter Interval : 20 Minimum Available Sampling Int : N/A Noise Level : N/A

Data_Set_PDS3.confidence_level_note: Overview ======== A recording interval of 20 minutes was adopted, so all data represent a 20 minute average of wind speed and temperature conditions. A malfunction in the analog to digital converter resulted in no temperature or wind direction data being recorded at Lunar Lake South.
